title: SMS secures deal with Aclara for supply of one million SMETS2 smart meters
lead: SMS is to be the first meter installer, manager and operator to offer Aclara’s complete portfolio of SMETS2 gas and electric smart meters to the UK utilities market.
author: Alice Grundy

title: How on-street charging is bridging the EV uptake divide between early adopters and lower income households
lead: For any new technology being rolled out across society, the question of how to ensure no one is left behind must be answered. Alice Grundy explores how on-street charging is supporting those in less affluent areas to get on board with the transition.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Interconnector capacity in Britain the most expensive in Europe
lead: ​The cost of interconnector capacity to Britain is the most expensive in Europe, according to new research from EnAppSys.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CBI urges government to 'make the big plays' and release transport and heat strategies
lead: ​The CBI is calling on the government to “step up” and release concrete strategies for transport and heat after a lack of detail in the Ten Point Plan.
author: Alice Grundy

title: How smart half-hourly readings can redefine the energy market
lead: Following Ofgem giving the green light to half hourly settlement, Tyron Vardy, chief product officer at energy software company ENSEK, takes a look at what this change will mean for the sector.
author: Tyron Vardy

title: Zap-Map boosts app features with launch of new subscription service
lead: ​Zap-Map is expanding its offering with the launch of a new subscription service aimed at electric vehicle (EV) drivers who regularly use public charging.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Royal Mail seeks to 'strengthen advantage' with plans for ten-fold increase in EVs
lead: ​Royal Mail is to boost its UK electric vehicle (EV) fleet ten-fold as part of its plans to slash emissions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: TSG announces new partnership with ‘great fit’ Jumptech
lead: ​Jumptech has announced a new partnership with electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure company TSG UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CMA opens investigation into National Grid’s WPD acquisition
lead: ​The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is launching an investigation into the acquisition of Western Power Distribution (WPD) by National Grid.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BP Pulse opens UK's first rapid EV charging hub for fleets
lead: ​The first UK rapid charging hub specifically for fleets has been opened by BP Pulse, with 10 50KW chargers already in the ground.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy associations band together to call on government to build back greener
lead: ​Britain’s energy sector has called on the government to seize the opportunity to deliver a green economic recovery.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Charge Enterprises announces strategic investment in ‘true trailblazer’ Connected Kerb
lead: ​US telecom company Charge Enterprises Inc has announced a strategic investment in UK electric vehicle (EV) charging company Connected Kerb.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: OVO claims UK's best value route to electric motoring as it forges Vanarama EV leasing deal
lead: ​OVO Energy has partnered with online vehicle leasing firm Vanarama to offer electric vehicle (EV) leasing deals through a new partner site.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ecotricity ‘hands the baton’ to GRIDSERVE as it acquires the Electric Highway
lead: ​Following the acquisition of a 25% stake in March, GRIDSERVE has now fully taken on Ecotricity’s Electric Highway electric vehicle (EV) charging network.
author: Alice Grundy

title: A 40-fold increase in low-carbon heating installation needed for net zero, finds ESC
lead: ​In order to hit the UK’s net zero target, the installation of low carbon heating systems needs to increase from 26,000 a year currently to 1.2 million by 2030.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: How Ohme is putting 'the driver in control and command' as it expands into Europe
lead: David Watson, CEO and founder of Ohme, told Current± about Ohme's fleet management platform, European partnership with Volvo and how focusing on tech "catalysed" the firm's move beyond its own hardware.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Four projects have cleared initial screening for Ofgem’s Electricity Network Innovation Competition
lead: Four projects have passed the initial screening for the Electricity Network Innovation Competition (NIC), with network operators seeking £29 million for green heat and flexibility.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF to close Dungeness B seven years early as the UK’s nuclear fleet dwindles
lead: EDF is to close its Dungeness B nuclear power station in Kent, seven years earlier than planned as the UK’s nuclear fleet continues to shrink.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: City of Edinburgh Council unveils new strategy to support 2030 net zero ambitions
lead: A strategic partnership between ​City of Edinburgh Council and SP Energy Networks has been formed as part of the former's new decarbonisation strategy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Heat batteries: The oft overlooked low-carbon heat solution and Caldera’s Warmstone offering
lead: Current± caught up with heat battery start-up Caldera founder and CEO James Macnaghten to discuss the economics of the technology, and the opportunity for the technology in the UK and beyond.
author: Molly Lempriere
